meanings.definition: Having the appearance of truth or reality.
meanings.sent1: The movie's verisimilitudinous special effects made the audience feel like they were part of the action.
meanings.sent2: Her verisimilitudinous painting of the landscape was so realistic that it looked like a photograph.
meanings.sent3: The verisimilitudinous costume made him look like a real superhero at the costume party.
meanings.sent4: The verisimilitudinous mask transformed her into a mysterious character for Halloween.
meanings.sent5: The verisimilitudinous details in the story made it hard to distinguish between fact and fiction.

meanings.sent1: The witness gave a verisimilitudinous account of the events that took place.
meanings.sent2: The artist's verisimilitudinous sculptures were so lifelike that they seemed to breathe.
meanings.sent3: His verisimilitudinous excuse for being late was actually quite creative.
meanings.sent4: The verisimilitudinous shadows in the painting added depth and dimension to the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The verisimilitudinous performance on stage transported the audience to another world.
